title: Dolce & Gabbana Fall 2017’s Glittering Crowns Are a Party Girl Must - Vogue
text: This Is How You Do Italian Girl Party Hair, According to Dolce & Gabbana February 26, 2017 9:02 PM by Monica Kim Photographed by Corey Tenold Today, as Milan Fashion Week is coming to a close, Domenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana presented a joyful Fall 2017 collection, filled with many of the classic Italian motifs they’ve made their own. Another homegrown tradition that shone on the runway was the house’s always-romantic beauty look, which this season provided a tongue-in-cheek lesson on Italian girl party hair. It calls for an all-out approach—many lengths blown out beautifully into loose waves, some then topped with a flashing gilded crown, as seen above on model Sonia Ben Ammar, for a little something that sparkles. Rather than play down the makeup, the Dolce & Gabbana girl piles it on with a perfectly lined matte red lip, full lashes, and a coat of liquid black eyeliner , drawn out from the eye into a feline flick à la Monica Vitti—truly bellissima .
